item.title: Isaac add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Never trust a man who reads only one book." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Cervantes
Isaac add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Charles Fuller
item.description: "To spend one's life being angry, and in the process doing nothing to change it, is to me ridiculous. I could be mad all day long, but if I'm not doing a damn thing, what difference does it make?" -- Charles Fuller

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Charles Fuller
item.description: "Waters: Not havin' ain't no excuse for not gettin" -- Charles Fuller

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "As a general rule,'he had once said, 'people ask for advice only in order not to follow it; or, if they do follow it, in order to have someone to blame for giving it.' (Athos)" -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Isaac add a quote by alexandre dumas
item.description: "Rogues are preferable to imbeciles because sometimes they take a rest." -- alexandre dumas

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And what would humans be without love?" RARE, said Death." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Time ripens all things; no man is born wise." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Isaac add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "You don't choose your friends, they choose you, and you either reject them or you accept them without reservations." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte
